title: Props & Component Composition
description: Pass data and build reusable components

refresher.title: What are Props?
refresher.content:
# Props (Properties) ## Why do we need them? Components should be reusable and configurable. Props let parent components pass data and behavior to children. ## Key Rules - Props are **read-only** - Can be any data type: strings, numbers, objects, functions - Destructure for cleaner code ## Example ```jsx ``` Inside Greeting component: ```jsx const Greeting = ({ name, age }) => { return

Hello {name}, you are {age}!

; }; ``` **Let's build a reusable card!**

negative.title: üêõ Common Mistake: Mutating Props
negative.description: This component tries to modify props directly. Why is this wrong?
negative.question: What's wrong with modifying props directly?

options.text: Props are immutable ‚Äì changes won't trigger re-renders and break one-way data flow
You need useState to modify data

negative.lesson: **Props are immutable.** Never mutate them directly. Use state or derive new values instead.
